fieldDescription:
Set true to enable devmode activation after campaign load or creation.
[Independent of start chosen and save loaded.]

fieldName: AUTO DEVMODE on Game App Start
fieldDescription:
Set true to enable devmode activation when game app loads.
Alternative to enabling devmode in game config or mod manager.
[Requires game restart to take effect.]

Set true to enable devmode switching off before saving.
Devmode is reenabled after save, so in most cases it should be seamless.
[Should prevent crashes for mods which can't create saves with active devmode.]

defaultValue: I have gonne with static default name as it makes cleaning save folder much easier. You can change them bellow for any reason.

fieldDescription: Change if you want to customize the autoset first name.
Change if you want to customize the autoset last name.
Change if you want to customize the autoset first name for [when Nexerelin is active].
Change if you want to customize the autoset last name for [when Nexerelin is active].

defaultValue: [Disclaimer: Mod uses combination of Java Robot's Class. It most likely isn't compatible with some OS and could also type outside the game if you are not careful. Of course the sequence is limited and not designed to softlock anything, but I can't guarantee perfect operation in all circumstances.]

Fill the string below for a customisable start option.

String is read from left to right and accepts one letter symbols:
[1-9] numbers corresponding to options in dialogue
[G] for skill select/start game screen
[F] for selecting fleet (type chosen based on selector lower is settings)
[E] for escape

For example string "[112E]" will result in choosing option 1, then option 1 again, then option 2, and lastly escape"

secondaryValue: SOLO, COMBAT_SMALL, TRADE_SMALL, EXPLORER_SMALL, CARRIER_SMALL, COMBAT_LARGE, TRADE_LARGE, CARRIER_LARGE, SUPER, GRAND_FLEET
fieldDescription:
Passes selected to rule called by using "F" symbol in string.

[MAKE SURE FLEET TYPE YOU USING IS PRESENT WHEN CALL HAPPENS.]
Delay between each input is seconds. From my testing even 0.05 works well. "G" input has additional delay to account for skill screen loading.
